course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Special Topics in Molecular, Cell and Developmental Biology
course.description: Recent advances in molecular, cell and developmental biology will be presented and discussed in lectures and tutorials.

reviews.author: DanielChan326
reviews.title: The BEST course ever <3
reviews.comment_content:
Prof. Yan
Given 5 papers to read before the lecture begin <3
Lecture 1:
- Introduction to Development Biology
- ***Selected Topic this year: Morphogenesis - Force generation and sensing machinery in embryos
- Reviewed related research article/ paper x 1
Lecture 2:
- Reviewed related research article/ paper x 2
Lecture 3:
- Reviewed related research article/ paper x 2

Prof. Liu
Lecture 1 - 3: Research in the field of "Axon regeneration" - many key footsteps and papers have been included in the slides.<3
Lecture 1:
- Introduction to spinal cord injury and CNS axon regeneration
- Molecular determinants of axon regeneration: Growth inhibitors
Lecture 2:
- Molecular determinants of axon regeneration: Intrinsic growth regulators
Lecture 3:
- Insights from other model organisms
- Other strategies: rehabilitation, neuromodulation  

Prof. Wu
Given 5 - 6 papers to read before the lecture begin <3
Lecture 1:
- Sequencing techniques well explained, Sanger / NGS  / N.NGS
- Major applications around NGS, e.g. Cancer research. pre-natal diagnostics, predicting organ transplant rejection...
- Advanced uses in research: RNA-seq, CHIP-seq, ATAC-seq, and Hi-C
Lecture 2:
- Why Single cell <3 and How
- Cell isolation techniques
- Single cell Atlas projects worldwide
Lecture 3:
- What is Synthetic biology
- Research articles related to synthetic biology
- What is Genome editing
- CRISPR/Cas9 and its applications

Prof. Wong
Lecture 1 - 3: Everything important about GPCRs <3
e.g.
- GPCR's families and classifications
- GPCR's structure and functional domains
- GPCR's splice variants
- GPCR's post-translational modifications
- GPCR's ligands
- Drug discovery around GPCRs
- Mechanism of activation of GPCR and G-protein
- GPCR dimerization, e.g. homodimer, heterodimer
- FRET/ BRET/ BiFc
- GPCR signaling / downstream regulation e.g. GRKs, b-arrestin
- more......

Prof. Guo
Lecture 1:
- Roadmap of secretory transport pathway
- Anterograde transport from the ER to the Golgi
- Retrograde transport from the Golgi to the ER
Lecture 2:
- Intra-Golgi transport
- Export of proteins out of the Golgi
- Protein degradation mediated by autophagy
Lecture 3:
- Endocytic transport pathway

Prof. Wen
Lecture 1: Hematopoietic Stem cells
Lecture 2: Tissue resident Macrophages
Lecture 3: Cytokine Signaling JAK STAT pathway
reviews.comment_teaching: It feels like the six legends in LIFS department feeding life science into your mouth.
reviews.comment_grading: Good, because it is a PG course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Presentation (40%)
- Present an assigned paper in 20 minutes + 10 minutes Q&A

Final Exam (60%)
- There are 6 long questions given by each professors, you can choose and answer 4 out of 6 questions.
